entry.title: Video: Correct `kDisableVideoOverlayIfMoving` feature's behaviour
entry.content:
The original feature has been used to workaround a issue that caused

by MPO feature which causing janky scrolling while video is in frame. And based on my test, the issue is not an Intel only issue, similar

things happens on NVIDIA and AMD GPUs, so the feature turns out to

be useful.



However the feature also introduced another issue that could cause a transition jank from black flashing and brightness shifts when HDR10

MPO got promoted and page scrolling.



My previous CL https://crrev.com/c/4958083 had make things better by

limit the promotion to "page fullscreen mode" only but not fix everything.



In this CL, we use `AllowClearVideoQuadCandidatesIfMoving` to replace

`IsClearVideoQuad` which add another HDR colorspace check, for HDR10

videos there always be a huge visual difference between compositor

tone-mapping (by Chrome) and HDR10 overlay tone-mapping (by Intel).

Do not enable `kDisableVideoOverlayIfMoving` when `HDR10 MPO` is

using could fix the transition jank issue.



Bug: 1056919

Bug: 1492817

Change-Id: I3e3c56dc731b0207facdc4b051d58f1e03e373dc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5107529

entry.title: infra: Define custom mega CQ run modes & enable it on mega cq builder
entry.content:
Now that crbug.com/1483511 is fixed and we're out of the freeze, we

should finally be able to hook-up the mega cq button in gerrit to an

actual cq attempt.



So this defines the two custom run_modes for the mega CQ & configures

the mega-cq-launcher builder to be triggered by that run mode.



The launcher will handle triggering sub-builds of real builders, so

we don't need to list any other builder on these run modes for now.

If/when we delete the launcher and use native CV functionality for the

mega CQ, then we'd need to allowlist all relevant builders. ie:

This TODO:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:infra/config/lib/builder_config.star;drc=dd5ca12dd573a863573e83f30486e7638aa43c60;l=793



But that's blocked on crbug.com/1483516.

entry.title: Deprecate compose PCO consent flows and replace with FRE dialog
entry.content:
We previously needed two distinct dialog states to represent possible dialog flows related to Page content opt-in (PCO). PCO is no longer being used as a separate setting/pref for controlling this feature, so this change removes both of those states and replaces them with a single FRE state. This FRE should precede the main Compose dialog iff the user has not already progressed past it in the compose UI by pressing the "Let's go" button.

As part of this switch, the old `kPrefHasAcceptedComposeConsent` profile pref is deprecated and replaced by `kPrefHasCompletedComposeFRE` for tracking the FRE for the profile. Migrating this pref was deemed unnecessary.



mojom changes:

Removal of the PCO flows means the tri-state ConsentState passed to the WebUI can be deprecated and replaced with a single bool representing FRE completion. Consent-related action and close paths are also deprecated, leading to updates to the mojom.



Two previous CLs implement smaller parts of this large change

https://crrev.com/c/5132237 defines new metrics and strings needed and https://crrev.com/c/5137979 adds the piping needed for the Learn more link press in the dialog to trigger a browser-side new tab navigation.



Screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4GnvbicPsjZnLUe.png



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Compose.Session.Consent.CloseReason]=Deprecated in M122, no longer used

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Compose.Session.Consent.DialogShownCount.Accepted]=Deprecated in M122, no longer used

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Compose.Session.Consent.DialogShownCount.Ignored]=Deprecated in M122, no longer used

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Compose.Session.Consent.GivenInSession]=Deprecated in M122, no longer used

entry.title: [Fast Pair] HID needs Floss
entry.content:
Adds a check for to make sure Floss is enabled for HID logic.

Currently, Fast Pair HID only works on Floss, so we need to make

sure that the user is using Floss before trying to pair a HID device.

This is not a major issue, since most devices that support Fast Pair

will be migrated to Floss, but it does address people who manually

toggle flag and the future where all devices can enable Fast Pair.

entry.title: [sync] Avoid deep copies of DeviceInfo in DeviceInfoTracker
entry.content:
This is a performance improvement that makes APIs calls such as

GetAllDeviceInfo(), as implemented by DeviceInfoSyncBridge,

significantly faster for users with a very large number of sync-ing

devices (deemed to be a rare scenario).



There are still codepaths under chrome/browser/sharing that perform

deep copies, now moved to the calling site. TODOs have been added to

tackle those in follow-up patches.

entry.title: [mojo] Use RunOrPostTask to send message on channel-assoc. interface.
entry.content:
RunOrPostTask provides the same ordering and mutual exclusion

guarantees as PostTask, but it may run its callback synchronously.

to reduce scheduling overhead. It's appropriate for short tasks (since

the task runs synchronously, the RunOrPostTask call may take as long

as running the callback).



The change is behind a base::Feature

("MojoChannelAssociatedSendUsesRunOrPostTask") to allow measuring its

impact or disabling it completely in case problems are found.



Bug: 1503967

Change-Id: I226032e3771741b674bb9b97cdfa635d76e3addf

entry.title: Record if filling was ever prevented due to cross iframe security policy in UKM
entry.content:
Autofill skips filling the fields in an unsafe iframe if the autofill

is triggered from a field in a different frame. Therefore, the same

field can be filled sometimes, or missed, depending on the field that

triggers the autofill.



In this CL, we are adding the status of fields to indicate if they

were ever prevented to be filled because of the cross iframe autofill

security policy that applies to credit cards, and whether they were

actually safely filled at last when the form was submitted.

entry.title: [omnibox] Moves StopAutocomplete and StartPrefetch to OmniboxController
entry.content:
This is intended to beef up the OmniboxController to play more of a

controller role in the MVC model and provide a consistent interface

for the caller to start/stop the Autocompletion flow.



This CL does not move OmniboxEditModel::StartZeroSuggestRequest() and

OmniboxEditModel::StartAutocomplete() to the OmniboxController yet.



Removes result() and query_in_progress() from OmniboxController. Given

the similar naming of OmniboxController and ACController, these

convenience methods can be confusing to the reader. These methods can

be called directly on an AutocompleteController instance which can be

obtained from the OmniboxController.

entry.title: [Android] Report NOTRUN for missing tests after instrumentation run
entry.content:
This changes the reported statuses from UNKNOWN to NOTRUN to match the

definition in //build/util/lib/results/result_types.py, for missing

tests in a finished instrumentation run.



The correct set of UNKNOWN tests (which we know they have started) in

a run are already detected in GenerateTestResults in

//build/android/pylib/instrumentation/instrumentation_test_instance.py



Batched (or individual) reruns are present in the test logic no matter

what status is reported here.

entry.title: focus-mode: Stop recursive focusing on disabled adjustment button
entry.content:
This CL prevents us from recursively changing focus when we move focus

from the timer setting textfield. Previously, we would set the inactive

session duration and update the enabled states of the timer adjustment

buttons when the textfield is blurred. This is called in the

FocusManager. However, SetEnabled will then try to change the focus

again while we are already changing focus. Thus, when we set the

decrement button to be disabled while focusing it, we end up adding the

FocusManager as an observer to the button twice. This leads to a

NOTREACHED in the ObserverList. We fix this by moving the

SetInactiveSessionDuration call to the HandleKeyEvent function in

TimerTextfieldController.



Bug: b/315358227

Change-Id: Ida4b9604e6cf908c4384d039825deb4a64bd293c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5137421

entry.title: Add field trial test config for IsolateSandboxIframes study.
entry.content:
This CL sets the necessary config to force tests to run with

the same settings as the trial, with per-origin mode being the

expected launch config.



A number of WPTs fail in the new configuration dues to existing

bugs. These are:



** Issue 1407078: beforeunload handlers triggered by window.close()

don't work in OOPIFs



fast/frames/sandboxed-iframe-close-top-noclose.html

fast/frames/sandboxed-iframe-close-top.html



** Issue 1066891: TestDriver click is flaky with cross-origin frames:



external/wpt/bluetooth/requestDevice/sandboxed_iframe.https.window.html

external/wpt/bluetooth/requestLEScan/sandboxed_iframe.https.window.html

virtual/web-bluetooth-new-permissions-backend/external/wpt/bluetooth/requestDevice/sandboxed_iframe.https.window.html

virtual/web-bluetooth-new-permissions-backend/external/wpt/bluetooth/requestLEScan/sandboxed_iframe.https.window.html



A number of WPTs have slightly different expected text output

with the new feature, since some warning console message are

treated differently for local vs. remote frames, and

IsolateSandboxIframes causes some frames that used to be local

to become remote.

(In these cases, the existing expected output has been updated to

match what a remote frame would show, with the original output

copied to a flag-specific directory since the tests also run in

the virtual test suite "disable-site-isolation-trials" without

the IsolateSandboxIframes behavior).



third_party/blink/web_tests/fast/frames/sandboxed-iframe-close-top-noclose-expected.txt

third_party/blink/web_tests/fast/frames/sandboxed-iframe-navigation-top-denied-expected.txt

third_party/blink/web_tests/http/tests/security/no-popup-from-sandbox-top-expected.txt

third_party/blink/web_tests/http/tests/security/sandboxed-iframe-form-top-expected.txt



Bug: 510122, 1407078, 1066891

Change-Id: Ib37e7d362c0e4362500232eb7bd454ae7096b12c

entry.title: Fix android plus_address modal view check
entry.content:
The prior check was for the UI suppression boolean, which is meant

to mimic null views and prevent additional unit test dependencies.

The correct check is for the existence of the view, which is not

present either with suppressed UI or with early dismissal while waiting

for the network response. Upcoming CLs will also expand browsertest

coverage of unusual UI scenarios; for now, this CL relies on the

existing unit test coverage of this case.

entry.title: Side Panel Pinning: Disable AnimatingLayoutManager
entry.content:
Currently there are 2 AnimatingLayoutManager living side by

side and it's causing race condition when both of them are trying

to animate. Since we know that only one AnimatingLayoutManager in the

toolbar view works, ExtensionsToolbarContainer has had animation for

many years, this CL temporally removes the animation in

PinnedToolbarActionsContainer until the issue is addressed.

entry.title: Return MediaCodec errors so they can be logged
entry.content:
Updates MediaCodecBridge.java to return the actual error reported by

MediaCodec.CryptoException to MediaCodecBridge. The functions in

MediaCodecBridge now return a TypedStatus, which includes the actual

error reason nested inside.



As a result, MediaCodecStatus is no longer returned as it is replaced by

MediaCodecResult. This affects a bunch of tests.



Also updates CodecWrapper::QueueInputBuffer and DequeueOutputBuffer to

also return a TypedStatus so that the actual error reason is available.



Tested by having MediaCodecBridge.java return an error and observing

that the error is logged in chrome://media-internals. Example when

INSUFFICIENT_OUTPUT_PROTECTION returned:

{

"cause": {

"cause": {

"code": 5,

"data": {},

"group": "MediaCodecResult",

"message":"The output protection levels supported by the device are not

sufficient to meet the requirements set by the content owner in the

license policy.",

"stack": [

{

"file": "media/base/android/media_codec_bridge_impl.cc",

"line": 241

}

]

},

"code": 1,

"data": {},

"group": "QueueStatus",

"message": "",

"stack": [

{

"file": "media/gpu/android/codec_wrapper.cc",

"line": 319

}

]

},

"code": 1,

"data": {},

"group": "DecoderStatus",

"message": "QueueInputBuffer failed",

"stack": [

{

"file": "media/gpu/android/media_codec_video_decoder.cc",

"line": 963

}

]

}



Bug: b:283544711

Test: see above

Change-Id: I4eb0d877a31076abcd4f80ab61d708e64de3ab29

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5142593

Reviewed-by: Ted (Chromium) Meyer

Commit-Queue: John Rummell

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1243024}

entry.content:
Overriding the IOSurface color space saves a significant amount of

power by avoiding the ICC profile parsing.



Unfortunately, recent OS changes (most likely related to reactions),

cause flickering when this optimization is enabled.



Disable this optimization for the moment.

entry.title: Move PDFiumFormFiller away from using blink::MainThreadIsolate()
entry.content:
Instead, have PDFiumFormFiller talk to PDFiumEngine, whose client

delegates to PdfViewWebPluginClient. PdfViewWebPluginClient can then

talk to the WebFrame to get the per-frame isolate.



While this removes blink::MainThreadIsolate() usage in production code,

the newly added GetIsolate() method needs to be implemented for unit

tests to pass. This CL adds two new test-only blink::MainThreadIsolate()

calls for now.

entry.title: media: Log Diagnostic Info during MediaDrmStateException
entry.content:
During crashes in ClearMediaDrmLicensesBlocking, the crash report states

there is an issue with setting the origin, and returns a

MediaDrmStateException. We originally were swallowing it without logging

the diagnostic info from the exception, and it was not available for us

to see on our crash reports. This CL makes the change so that we can see

from the crash reports details from the exception.

group name will be the same.

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Remove unnecessary DuplicateFds call
entry.content:
When importing the planes from a NativePixmapHandle, we duplicate the

FD's and store them in a vector of base::ScopedFD, which are used to

construct a VideoFrame. Since they are duplicated when creating the

vector, we don't need to duplicate them again.



This doesn't impact the long-term file descriptor usage, but avoids

temporary usage.



BUG=b:277581596

TEST=VDAtests on hana

entry.title: Wait for FCP before running color-mix tests
entry.content:
Several color-mix tests started flaking after the following CL was

submitted leading to a revert of the CL.



https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5014009



The underlying cause appears to be that the screenshots could be taken

too soon. This CL addresses the issue by waiting for first contentful

paint before running the test.



Verified that the reverted patch flakes without this fix and passes with

the fix.

entry.title: [FedCM] Fix promise resolution in multiIDP array case
entry.content:
Currently, the first IDP in the array will result in the promise being

resolved. This means that choosing an account from the non-first IDP

in a get() call will result in failure even if the token request is

successful. To fix this, we store the list of IDPs along with their

resolver, and we check whether the list contains the selected IDP

when we need to resolve or reject the promise.



Bug: 1515128

Change-Id: Ibd3e4a0b52c2b827b0daa286f3d40987f414b882

entry.content:

navigation, AsyncCheckTracker will trigger the interstitial when

DidFinishNavigation is called. The has_post_commit_interstitial_skipped

bit is passed from the callback in UnsafeResource.

entry.title: Set type text and web password when a password field is shown.
entry.content:
🌎 Previously, this logic was added to handle when a password field is

shown to the user. It marks the field as a password still despite

it being plain text.

⛔ The if statement checks whether TYPE_NUMBER_VARIATION_PASSWORD was

applied and runs the logic if this isn't the case. However, when

toggled to plain text, a password variation won't be applied so

the code was always firing for numeric password inputs. The effect

of this was that when showing a numeric password field, the

keyboard would switch from numbers only to a full keyboard.

✅ This change checks whether the numeric field has been a password

in the past and if so, applies the TYPE_NUMBER_VARIATION_PASSWORD

type.



Bug: 304595684

Change-Id: If744b268a71fde35b2a5e2bf9e36525b9c5184ab

entry.title: SyncToSigninMigration: Also check ReplaceSyncPromos flag
entry.content:
This adds a check to the SyncToSignin migration logic, to only run the

migration if the ReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos flag is also enabled

(in addition to the actual MigrateSyncingUserToSignedIn flag).



In practice, the "Migrate" flag should never be enabled without the

"Replace" flag, so this doesn't really make a difference, but it can

prevent weird things happening during manual testing.

entry.title: Speculative fix of ProfileTokenQuality CHECK() failure
entry.content:
In AddObservation(type), the CHECK() that the type is among the

supported types of the profile fails. Earlier in the call stack, in

AddObservationsForFilledForm() this condition is already verfied - but

before calling GetStorableTypeOf(). This shouldn't make a difference,

and testing different address models locally, I couldn't make this

crash. This CL nonetheless moves the GetStorableTypeOf() call before

the existing condition. It also starts outputting the type, if the

CHECK() fails. This should make debugging easier, if this doesn't fix

the problem.



Moreover, this CL simplifies the GetStorableTypeOf() implementation

using GetNodeForType().



Fixed: 1515409

entry.title: Mark pointer to FocusManager in View as not dangling.
entry.content:
Prior to this CL, the BorderView class in focus_traversal_unittest.cc

did not react properly to destruction: The Widget hosted by it was not

destroyed. As a result, the Views contained by this Widget were not

destroyed on the destruction of the host view and, as a result, their

pointers to the FocusManager of the Widget owning the BorderView became

dangling.



Bug: 1469136

entry.title: SyncToSigninMigration: Add overall outcome metric
entry.content:
This adds a histogram "Sync.SyncToSigninMigrationOutcome" which tracks

the overall outcome of the migration (everything successful or not).

Most importantly, the total count of this histogram tracks how many

migrations were completed. This can be compared to the "Migrate" bucket

of "Sync.SyncToSigninMigrationDecision" to verify that all migrations

that were started also finished.

entry.title: Filter text processing items if Manage apps is supported
entry.content:
Translate option is observed twice if Manage app is supported

and issue is observed until Manage apps is not used.

Issue is observed because getString query on contentresolver

returns null if Manage apps is not used as string value is

updated initially when preference fragment is created.

entry.title: [iOS] Correctly reset identity after a Save to Photos upload fails
entry.content:
This CL fixes an issue where the SaveToPhotosMediator did not correctly

reset the identity when an upload fails. As a result, when tapping

"Cancel" in the account picker view after a first failure has occurred,

the mediator would assume that an upload is still ongoing and try to

cancel it and stop the activity indicator, firing a DCHECK.



When a failure occurs, `_identity` is now reset to nil systematically,

and only when the user does "Try Again" through the alert will it be

set back to its previous value i.e. the identity for which the upload

first failed.



Fixed: 1513898

Change-Id: I77e11daa3ff13bd486acaf8e82120f34241e663a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5163589

entry.title: [iOS] Prevent launching Chrome from within Chrome
entry.content:
AppLauncherAbuseDetector has logic to block URLs that try to launch

Chrome from within Chrome, since these are typically only used for

abuse (legitimate use cases for these URLs all involve other apps

wanting to launch Chrome, not random websites trying to launch

Chrome from within Chrome).



This logic was unintentionally bypassed by the changes in

https://crrev.com/c/4936008. This CL moves this logic to

AppLauncherTabHelper, merging it with existing logic to block the

same kinds of URLs that was previously specific to iframes. This

CL also moves the histogram that was recorded for these URLs in

AppLauncherAbuseDetector to AppLauncherTabHelper.



Bug: 1515137

Change-Id: Iedb1398ed40f208d8ce4d31a44d5620388181e30

entry.title: [Downloads] Log DownloadItemWarningData from ChromeOS notifications
entry.content:
We previously did not log DownloadItemWarningData when download warnings

are shown in ChromeOS download notifications. This is important since

notifications are the first (and most visible) surface where download

warnings are shown on ChromeOS. This CL fixes that by adding

DownloadItemWarningData from Lacros v2 download notifications

(b/279831939).
